Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; traces of two added white bands; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on either side of the sherd may simply be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on the exterior surface of Chalice Style vases is not usually extensive. Furthermore, the rims on some vases of this style are not decorated, unlike those of other styles. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 21.1.37)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1478) (phase 2)
